Description: Shallow asymmetrical arsenical copper axe-head: with a convex cutting-edge and a concave butt drilled with three binding-holes. The blade is thickly corroded. Substantial traces of linen wrapping are preserved in the corrosion product around the cutting edge and on both faces. Remains of the original wooden haft also survive.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (71)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
